meanings.definition: To cause someone to stop breathing and die by suffocation.
meanings.sent1: The lack of air in the room asphyxiated the poor mouse.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter saved the cat that was asphyxiated in the burning building.
meanings.sent3: The balloon asphyxiated after too much air was blown into it.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the library asphyxiated any chance of conversation.
meanings.sent5: The heavy smoke asphyxiated the entire forest, leaving it lifeless.

meanings.definition: To be deprived of oxygen and unable to breathe.
meanings.sent1: The mountaineer felt asphyxiated at the high altitude.
meanings.sent2: The diver panicked when he asphyxiated underwater.
meanings.sent3: The fish looked asphyxiated when it jumped out of the water.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's stamina asphyxiated during the long race.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut's helmet protected him from being asphyxiated in space.
